communications.subject: FRESNO CA City Public Records Request::R042681-100523:: R042681-100523
communications.communication:
Dear CJ Ciaramella: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of City of Fresno. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the California Public Records Act (CPRA). Your request was received on 8/22/2019 and given the reference number R042681-100523 for tracking purposes. Your request mentioned: 
 Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
- All available misconduct records or serious use-of-force investigations regarding Fresno Police Department officer Christopher Martinez .
Please note that under Senate Bill 1421’s amendments to California Penal Code sections 832.7 and 832.8, certain types police misconduct records are now public records under California law. These records include:
- Records related to any incident where a law enforcement officer fired a gun at a person (regardless of whether someone was hit), or used force that resulted in serious injury or death.
- Records related to incidents where the agency found that an officer committed sexual assault against a member of the public—which includes attempts to coerce sex or proposition sex while on duty.
- Records related to incidents where the agency found that an officer engaged in dishonesty in the investigation, reporting, or prosecution of crime or police misconduct. This kind of dishonesty could include filing a false report, testifying untruthfully, or planting evidence.
I therefore request any such records concerning officer Martinez during his employment at the Fresno Police Department. 
If reassigned to the City Attorney's Office for processing, the City Attorney’s Office will coordinate with other City Departments regarding the collection and review process of responsive records. Within 10 days of receipt of your request, you will be contacted about the availability of the records in question, unless the response time is extended by written notification to you. PLEASE NOTE: The CPRA does not require a governmental body to create new records to respond to a request, do legal research, or answer questions that seek information only and do not seek production of an existing public record. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. You will receive an email if an extension of time is required and once your request has been completed. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact the City Attorney’s Office at 559-621-7500. For Police Department requests, you may contact the Police Department's Record's Division at 559-621-2534. 
Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Fresno 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HfI5405t2bA54aoypXnj-2FSO07RI3WToebYy1O5awiQ2k08sKgL16ge67DeHxSRcKX7C5BlSwfeiMJFXKUFBNWCg-3DB2LI_5gb6S8lW0f0M2KkrlI-2BS-2BcHQXA6bPFQbN7JsJHi1CsMFw4q-2FO8qzxDCbLVPG4zewyIIkxXn10-2BDuVLqh8TqiXaD7IDFLm-2B29fAm33O0a631I0OzDAiCt-2FRvNNvABZn7JHsA1EhLNiHkJTBgZvHGF8dIC7BXeAQGJQK4FhypHRpWTDY-2FSFgJFxzNV63nRvZXGuljWbAd8lFe4e0OliDq8gyEBBZ5NgmA5asX7rcln5CvVxzPYY43pXwlqQg8v7dOvP8fu3iz-2FMMiZEEdxRvBgEz7ra2-2FdaqBP7pO6tZY3SVc9uTf3cbScIpOqbvj99Rmfeipke0ZrDwbH8v5b-2FpSum2bYMjCHfsYngHw7EVWA9qig8J5o4uvT25TdjSeFQyUUPNclNJdvtxZwyqP-2BwCeAKg-3D-3D)

Florence Earl

title: Employee concerns/complaints over working for Ryan Kelly

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Employee concerns/complaints over working for Ryan Kelly
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All complaints filed to by employees to human resources, their supervisors, the mayor,  the administrator, legal or any other individual or entity regarding being scared to work with Ryan Kelly or their concerns with working for Ryan Kelly after his felony arrest for eavesdropping on them and his felony arrest for burglary and the inventory of his weapons found in his house without a FOID.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carolyn

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Personnel Files, Principals
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

*Leonard Harris, current principal at Nancy B Jefferson High School
*Sharnette Sims, current principal at York High School
*Joenile Albert-Reese, current principal at Pritzker Elementary
*Heidy Moran, current principal at Schurz High School

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-personnel-files-principals-160716%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ9RYhgoBNi1Pb8mf_KKixYw%3A1rmPYI%3AaOzCI_BtKIDQSOdqPVxu4DGTfL27ateIW9Mwgit9Yok 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15035

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
04/30/2024 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015035-031824 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

*Leonard Harris, current principal at Nancy B Jefferson High School 
*Sharnette Sims, current principal at York High School 
*Joenile Albert-Reese, current principal at Pritzker Elementary 
*Heidy Moran, current principal at Schurz High School 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcps-personnel-files-principals-160716%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ9RYhgoBNi1Pb8mf_KKixYw%3A1rmPYI%3AaOzCI_BtKIDQSOdqPVxu4DGTfL27ateIW9Mwgit9Yok 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, signatures, personal addresses, health information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Section 7.5(h) exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). 
Redactions have been made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r), which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of students and any student records in which a student may be individually identified by a school regardless of how or where the information pursuant to (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Redactions have also been made in accordance with 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(j)(iii) which exempts from release information concerning a school or university’s adjudication of student disciplinary cases, but only to the extent that disclosure would unavoidably reveal the identity of the student. 
Certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. Names and personal information of complainants and victims have been redacted pursuant to section 7(d)(iv) of the FOIA which exempts confidential information furnished only by the confidential source, or persons who file complaints with or provide information to administrative, investigative, law enforcement, or penal agencies. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USPS Kiosk Digital Photographs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Data management policies regarding USPS Self Service Kiosks (SSKs)
- Records related to USPS SSKs taking digital photographs of customers, excluding photographs of customers
- Privacy Impact Assessments for USPS SSKs
- Business Impact Assessments for USPS SSKs

For reference, a FOIA request from the Electronic Privacy Information Center found the kiosks captured and stored photographs of customers for a period of 30 days, this request seeks similar records. (See https://epic.org/wp-content/uploads/privacy/postal/postalapc.pdf)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dwight Pina

title: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

> A copy of the contract with strategic consulting firm ICF that resulted in the publication of the "Climate Affordability Study" published in December 2023 to inform New York State’s forthcoming Cap-and-Invest Program.
> A list of names of ICF contractors involved in the preparation of the Climate Affordability Study.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYS Climate Affordability Study Contract (New York State Energy Research and Development Authority)
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone-

I write to acknowledge receipt of the request that you submitted to the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA").  Your request seeks the information outlined below.

Your request has been referred to the appropriate NYSERDA program areas to search for the records that are responsive to your request.  NYSERDA will contact you in twenty (20) business days to (i) advise whether it has any records that are responsive to your request; (ii) grant or deny your request, if it has responsive records; or (iii) apprise you of the progress of your request, if the search or review of the records that you requested is still on-going.


Colleen Dawson

communications.subject: Mayor's Office :: C172681-022724
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on February 27, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C172681-022724. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 159440-87342208@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C172681-022724:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The administrative tracking file for the request C167172-011424, and all e-mail, memoranda, and records of phone calls created in the processing of that request, and related metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Meanwhile, I will run a search for any emails, SharePoint documents or any other memoranda and will check with MOS to see if any phone calls were created in regard to C167172, from January 14, 2024 (the date we received C167172-011424) through February 27, 2024 (the date we closed C167172-011424).

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C172681-022724
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C172681-022724 received on February 27, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C172681-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C172681-022724. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C172681-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: Thomas P. Stafford (September 17, 1930 – March 18, 2024) (National Personnel Records Center, Military Personnel Records)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Thomas P. Stafford (September 17, 1930 – March 18, 2024) (National Personnel Records Center, Military Personnel Records)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel records for astronaut and Air Force general Thomas P. Stafford (September 17, 1930 – March 18, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/18/science/space/thomas-p-stafford-dead.html

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an associate editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015096-040124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
April 30, 2024 Miriam Bhimani 161542-36847347@requests.muckrock.com 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015096-040124 
Dear Ms. Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Chair, from March 01, 2024 to March 31, 2024. 

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from public disclosure; those portions have been redacted including personal email addresses and other highly personal information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Further, redactions were applied to mask communications between a parent and their child’s school district pursuant to section 7(1)(c). Parents have a personal privacy interest under 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c) in their identifying information when they contact their child’s school to express opinions. (See Ill. Att' y Gen. PAC Req. Rev. Ltr. 38873, issued June 30, 2016, at 4-5 and Ill. Att' y Gen. PAC Req. Rev. Ltr. 56488). Personally identifiable student record information has been redacted in accordance with the Illinois School Student Records Act 105 ILCS 10/1 et seq. and the corresponding Section 7.5(r) FOIA exemption (5 ILCS 140/7.5(r)). Redactions have been made pursuant to section 7(1)(f) which exempts from release “[p]reliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body. The exemption provided in this paragraph (f) extends to all those records of officers and agencies of the General Assembly that pertain to the preparation of legislative authority.” 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f). Furthermore, this exemption is “intended to protect the communications process and encourage frank and open discussion among agency employees before a decision is made." State Journal-Register v. Univ. of Ill. Springfield, 994 N.E.2d 705, 713 (2013). Further, records have been redacted in accordance with section 7(1)(m) of the FOIA to remove information constituting privileged attorney-client work product. Section 7(1)(m) of the FOIA exempts from release “[c]ommunications between a public body and an attorney or auditor representing the public body that would not be subject to discovery in litigation, and materials prepared or compiled by or for a public body in anticipation of a criminal, civil, or administrative proceeding upon the request of an attorney advising the public body.” 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(m). To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. If you have any questions, please contact our office at (773) 553-3500. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Annie Righi Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA - Shared Mailboxes (email) (Atlanta Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A CSV export of your agency's Shared Mailboxes (see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/email/about-shared-mailboxes?view=o365-worldwide for more info ) including the following parameters for every shared mailbox:

- Primary SMTP Address
- Date Created

A simple way to retrieve this is by having a member of IT (such as a System Administrator) run the following command in Exchange Online PowerShell (if email is hosted in a Microsoft Exchange environment):

Get-Mailbox -ResultSize Unlimited -RecipientTypeDetails SharedMailbox | Select Name,PrimarySmtpAddress,WhenCreated | Export-CSV -Path .\SharedMailboxes_$((Get-Date).ToString('MM-dd-yyyy_hh-mm-ss')).csv

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: FOIA - BART - Drafts of Anime Mascots

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: FOIA - BART - Drafts of Anime Mascots
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any HTML, DOC, PDF, PNG, and/or JPEG files sufficient to serve as drafts of the following illustrations and details of the official BART Anime Mascots featured at https://www.bart.gov/news/anime

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: School Assignment Requests in  Quarter 1, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Anonymized data of all school assignment requests made on behalf of
CPS students with IEPs requiring placement from
January 01, 2024 to March 31, 2024. These records
should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the
date their IEP was finalized, the date the school assignment request
was made, the date the school assignment letter was issued, and the
date the student enrolled.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit
The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive
any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me
with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15099

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015099-040124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
April 29, 2024 Miriam Bhimani Re: Chicago Public Schools (CPS) FOIA Request N015099-040124 Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: Anonymized data of all school assignment requests made on behalf of CPS students with IEPs requiring placement from January 01, 2024 to March 31, 2024. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the date their IEP was finalized, the date the school assignment request was made, the date the school assignment letter was issued, and the date the student enrolled. RESPONSE: Data reflecting some, but not all, of the information sought in this part of your request is available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. The FOIA office has been advised by the CPS Office of Diverse Learners Supports and Services that it does not maintain any single system or database that comprehensively tracks each datapoint listed in this portion of your request. The raw data being provided reflects the date of assignment requests made and the date of assignments being finalized. In order to respond to this portion of your request fully, the District would be required to first analyze individual IEP and assignment records and then cross-reference them with enrollment records in order to create a brand-new dataset. That new dataset would then have to be anonymized. Please note that the Illinois Freedom of Information Act applies only to existing records that a public body has chosen to create and maintain in the normal course of its business. It does not require the District to prepare or create records that did not exist at the time the request was made. [5 ILCS 140/1] Accordingly, the District has no further records responsive to your request. To the extent you consider this a denial of your request, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706 . You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11.  Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: FEMA Student ID Certificates (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FEMA Student ID Certificates (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 
Can you please authenticate the following information and provide the following records:
Department of Homeland Security > Federal Emergency Management Agency > Student Identification Number: 0000866833

Also please provide a list of certificated held by this ID number and the name attached to this ID Number.

Sincerely,

Mason C. Turner
TurnerMason@gmail.com

communications.subject: Department of Homeland Security FOIA 2024-HQFO-00899 Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
03/01/2024 

SENT VIA E-MAIL TO:  159425-80181263@requests.muckrock.com 

Mason Turner 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 159425 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

Re:  2024-HQFO-00899 

Dear Requester: 

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 2/29/2024, and seeking Department of Homeland Security > Federal Emergency Management Agency > Student Identification Number: 0000866833. Also please provide a list of certificated held by this ID number and the name attached to this ID Number. Your request was received in this office on 2/29/2024. 

After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is too broad in scope or did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, 6 C.F.R. Part 5 §5.3(b) of the DHS FOIA regulations require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the DHS component or office you believe created and/or controls the record. The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records. 

A list of DHS Component and Offices is located online to aid in providing more information: https://www.dhs.gov/operational-and-support-components.  Additionally, your identified DHS Components or Offices may have their own FOIA office for FOIA request submissions.  A list of DHS FOIA Offices is located online:  https://www.dhs.gov/foia-contact-information.  If your identified DHS Component or Office has a FOIA office, please submit directly to that office.  Otherwise, respond back with your additional information. 

Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking.  This is not a denial of your request.  Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request.  If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed. 

You have a right to appeal the above determination.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to:  Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2).  Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 
You may contact the DHS FOIA Public Liaison at 202-343-1743 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request.  You may also contact OGIS at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-HQFO-00899.  Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. If you have any questions, or would like to discuss this matter, please feel free to contact this office at 1-866-431-0486 or at 202-343-1743. 

Regards, 

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office 
Department of Homeland Security 
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE 
Mail Stop 0655 
Washington, DC 20528-0655 
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov 
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2024-FEFO-00511
communications.communication:
Good Morning:

Please refer to the communication that our office sent to you on March 11, 2024. The text of that communication is pasted below for your convenience:

03/11/2024

SENT

VIA E-MAIL TO: 159426-09004793@requests.muckrock.com

Re: FOIA Request Number 2024-FEFO-00511
Clarification & ID verification required.

Dear Mason Turner:

This email acknowledges receipt of your March 8, 2024 confirmation email that

you with to pursue your request for educational transcripts and certifications under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA.) You are indicated that you are seeking Emergency Management Institute (EMI) transcripts and the National Response Framework transcripts,

etc. on behalf of yourself.

Please explain what you mean by "etc." What other training programs besides the EMI and National Response Framework do you want our office to search for? What is the date range that you attended these programs? If we do

not receive clarification within the time frame that was indicated in our acknowledgment letter (COB on March 22, 2024) your request will be administratively closed.

An individual’s request for information pertaining to him/her is processed under both

the FOIA and the Privacy Act (PA) to afford maximum access to records. Because you have asked for copies of records about yourself, we must verify your identity to ensure that your personal information is not released to anyone other than you. The DHS regulations,

6 CFR Part 5 §5.21(d), require verification of your identity, including your full name, current address and date and place of birth. In addition, your request must be made in writing, must contain your signature, and should either be notarized or contain a

statement made under penalty of perjury as permitted by 28 U.S.C. 1746.

If we do not hear from you within the time frame already stated with the requested information, we will process your request with the understanding that you did not provide the

requested authorization.

This is not a denial of your request. Upon receipt of the requested information, you will be advised as to the status of your FOIA with FEMA.

If you have any questions or would like to discuss this matter, please contact

the assigned FOIA specialist directly at amanda.christman@associates.fema.dhs.gov and reference the request number 2024-FEFO-00511. Again, if you require additional support, you may also contact FEMA’s Public Liaison at FEMA-FOIA@fema.dhs.gov. If you need

to contact FEMA’s FOIA Public Liaison, then please reference the FOIA request number and address your email to “Attn: FEMA’s Public Liaison” and summarize your concerns.

You may also contact FEMA at (202) 646-3323, or you may contact FEMA’s Public

Liaison in the same manner. Please reference FOIA request number 2024-FEFO-00511.
For a faster response please communicate by email.

Thank you for your interest in FEMA.

Sincerely,


Disclosure Branch
Information Management

Division
Office of the Chief Administrative Officer
Federal Emergency Management Agency
U.S. Department of Homeland Security

 

 

Amanda Christman

Analyst | Disclosure | Information Management Division

Phone: (202) 212-5078

amanda.christman@associates.fema.dhs.gov

Federal Emergency Management Agency

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents related to the selection and procurement of the [court’s] case management, docketing and electronic filing systems.

In specific:
- Contracts with the current vendor(s), including the currently active contracts and any previous contracts with the same vendor
- The request(s) for proposals to which the current vendor(s) responded
- Responses from other vendors to the same request for proposals
- Documents evaluating the proposals, or justifying the decision
- If there was no RFP for a vendor, any documents justifying the arrangement

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Colin MacArthur

communications.subject: Request for records of selection and procurement of electronic filing system contractor
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. McArthur:

The Office of Court Administration (hereafter "the Office") is in receipt of your request for records under the Texas Public Information Act, which we are construing as a request for judicial records under Rule 12<https://www.txcourts.gov/media/1456650/texas-rules-of-judicial-administration.pdf> of the Texas Rules of Judicial Administration.  A copy of your request, which was received by the Office on April 24, 204, is attached for reference.

Your request seeks copies of records of the procurement and selection "of the [court's] case management, docketing, and electronic filing systems" and specifically requests a copy of the current and the previous contract with the current vendor, the request for proposals issued in procuring the vendor's services, responses from other vendors, and documents evaluating the proposals or justifying the decision. The Office is currently under contract to provide an electronic filing system ("e-File 2.0") for use in the courts throughout Texas. Your reference to the term "the court's" case management, docketing, and electronic filing systems implies a statewide system maintained by the Supreme Court of Texas. We are construing your request to refer to the e-File system. Many, though not all, of the local courts maintain their own case management systems which were procured at the county level. The Office is not the custodian of the records of the procurement or contracts of those local case management systems. To access records of local case management systems, you must file a public information request to the clerks of the district or county courts.

Please note that the Office did procure the services of approximately three contractors on a separate project to develop a case management system for small or rural counties which would not otherwise procure an automated case management system. However, the Office procured contractors to be available to contract with the counties. Since the Office's contracts were not for statewide (or local) case management, docketing, or electronic filing services but were for contractors to be made available to contract with counties to obtain their own case management systems (if they chose to do so), this project did not seem to fit within the scope of your request. Please let me know if this is not correct and you wish to have copies of records relating to the procurement and contracting on that project.

You may find a copy of the current contract for e-File system at this webpage: https://www.txcourts.gov/jcit/electronic-filing/.

A copy of the request for offer issued to procure the current contract is available here: https://www.txsmartbuy.com/esbd/212210180.

A copy of the original contract and six amendments is attached to this email.

A copy of the memo documenting the recommendation of the selected the vendor and the rationale for the recommendation is also attached.

It will take more time to review the other responses to the Office's request for offers. I will provide copies of those records to you within a reasonable time but not later than 14 days in accordance with Rule 12.6. I am sending the attached copies of records separately in the interest of responding promptly.
Regards,
Scott Gibson
Assistant General Counsel
Texas Office of Court Administration
512.463.1461

communications.subject: Request for records of selection and procurement of electronic filing system contractor -- Part 2
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. MacArthur:

As a follow up to my disclosure of judicial records on Friday, April 26, 2024, please find attached eight documents responsive to your request in accordance with Rule 12 of the Texas Rules of Judicial Administration.  The attached documents are responses to the solicitation 212200385 for an electronic filing system.  Tyler Technologies specified information in its response, including a cost workbook which specified its proposed fees for proposed goods and services in its response, as confidential and proprietary. That information was redacted from its response.  The redacted information and the Tyler cost workbook are withheld under Rule 12.5(i)(3) which exempts from required disclosure "a trade secret or commercial or financial information made privileged or confidential by statute or judicial decision."

Under Rule 12.9, you have the right to appeal the denial of access to judicial records.  You may appeal by filing a written petition for review with the Administrative Director of the Office of Court Administration at the following address:


                                                                                                                                Ms. Megan LaVoie, Administrative Director
                                                                                                                                Office of Court Administration
                                                                                                                                P.O. Box 12066
                                                                                                                                Austin, Texas  78711-2066

Please note that the petition for review must be filed no later than 30 days after you receive this notice of the denial of copies of requested copies.  If you wish to file a petition, please note the requirements regarding the contents of the petition and the appellate process in Rule 12<https://www.txcourts.gov/media/524153/rjac-rule-12.pdf>.

There are no further records responsive to your request.

Please contact me if you have difficulties accessing the attachments.

Sincerely,
Scott Gibson
Assistant General Counsel
Texas Office of Court Administration
(512)463-1461

title: Covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, and domestic intelligence activities. (Hermosa Beach Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, and domestic intelligence activities. (Hermosa Beach Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request – Request for Expedited Processing

Dear FOIA Officer,

This letter serves as a formal request under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the applicable regulations, for access to records in the possession of this agency related to covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, and domestic intelligence activities.

As an American citizen exercising my rights under the FOIA, I hereby request expedited processing of this request due to its significant public interest and the urgency of the matter.

I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Internal memoranda, directives, and communications discussing the planning, execution, and objectives of covert operations, including any references to historical programs such as COINTELPRO and MK Ultra.
2. Operational plans, strategies, and guidelines governing surveillance and intelligence-gathering activities, including any coordination with community policing initiatives.
3. Records of surveillance operations, including logs, reports, and warrants obtained for monitoring targeted individuals or groups, as well as any watch lists or databases utilized.
4. Intelligence reports, assessments, and analyses resulting from surveillance and infiltration efforts, including assessments of private contractors involved.
5. Training materials, manuals, and protocols used to educate personnel involved in covert operations, including materials related to community alerts or coordination with neighborhood watch groups.
6. Budgetary documents related to the funding and allocation of resources for covert surveillance and intelligence activities.
7. Legal opinions, guidance, and interpretations concerning the legality and oversight of covert programs.
8. After-action reports, evaluations, and assessments conducted to review the effectiveness and impact of covert operations.
9. Copies of contracts, agreements, and invoices involving any third-party contractors engaged in activities specified above.
10. All records of complaints, investigations, and disciplinary actions related to the aforementioned activities.

This request also includes documents related to activities synonymous with or related to "Cointelpro 2.0," encompassing covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, undercover investigations, disruption programs, counterterrorism measures, covert infiltration tactics, political surveillance programs, coercive intelligence operations, and national security investigations.

I request that all responsive records be provided to me in electronic format, preferably via email or a secure online portal. If certain documents are exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation of the applicable exemptions and provide segregable portions that can be released.

Please process this request specifically for Evan L Rees, as the documents sought are requested in relation to myself.

I am willing to pay reasonable fees associated with this request. If the estimated fees exceed $50.00, please notify me in advance of processing the request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for your prompt handling of this request. I look forward to your timely response.

Sincerely,

Evan L Rees

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Evan L Rees

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #PD2024-8
communications.communication:
Subject: Response to FOIA Request - Clarification and Additional Information

Dear City of Sierra Madre Police Department,

Thank you for your prompt response to my Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. In response to your letter, I am providing the necessary clarification and additional information as requested.

Regarding the clarification of the time period for items 3, 4, 6, 8, and 9 of my FOIA request, the requested timeframe spans from April 5, 2002, to April 5, 2024.

Additionally, I acknowledge your concern regarding the broad nature of my initial request. I assure you that my intention is to obtain pertinent information within the defined scope while minimizing unnecessary burden on your department.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that this clarification and additional information will assist in expediting the processing of my FOIA request. Should you require any further clarification or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me directly.

Sincerely,
EVAN L REES

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #PD2024-8
communications.communication:
Dear Reanna Guzman,

Thank you for your prompt response.

Yes, indeed, my request pertains to records from the Hermosa Beach Police Department. I apologize for any confusion caused by the email thread. To clarify, I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Internal memoranda, directives, and communications discussing the planning, execution, and objectives of covert operations, including any references to historical programs such as COINTELPRO and MK Ultra.
2. Operational plans, strategies, and guidelines governing surveillance and intelligence-gathering activities, including any coordination with community policing initiatives.
3. Records of surveillance operations, including logs, reports, and warrants obtained for monitoring targeted individuals or groups, as well as any watch lists or databases utilized.
4. Intelligence reports, assessments, and analyses resulting from surveillance and infiltration efforts, including assessments of private contractors involved.
5. Training materials, manuals, and protocols used to educate personnel involved in covert operations, including materials related to community alerts or coordination with neighborhood watch groups.
6. Budgetary documents related to the funding and allocation of resources for covert surveillance and intelligence activities.
7. Legal opinions, guidance, and interpretations concerning the legality and oversight of covert programs.
8. After-action reports, evaluations, and assessments conducted to review the effectiveness and impact of covert operations.
9. Copies of contracts, agreements, and invoices involving any third-party contractors engaged in activities specified above.
10. All records of complaints, investigations, and disciplinary actions related to the aforementioned activities.

This request also includes documents related to activities synonymous with or related to "Cointelpro 2.0," encompassing covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, undercover investigations, disruption programs, counter-terrorism measures, covert infiltration tactics, political surveillance programs, coercive intelligence operations, and national security investigations.

If there are any additional steps I need to take or further information you require to process my request, please do not hesitate to let me know. I appreciate your assistance in this matter and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Thank you,

Evan L Rees
MuckRock News

City of Hermosa Beach ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-174 has been submitted successfully. This is an automated response.   Thank you for contacting the City of Hermosa Beach. If you submitted your request during our business hours [7:00 am – 6:00 pm], Monday through Thursday, the City has received and is reviewing your request. If you have sent this message on a holiday or when we are closed, we will receive and review your request when our business hours resume.   This message serves as notification of receipt and the City’s intent to comply with your request for public records, pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.). Under the Public Records Act, the City has ten (10) days to respond to any request for public documents by indicating whether or not the documents exist and will be made available. Actual production of the documents may take longer depending upon the nature, volume, or complexity of the request.   In the meantime, if you have any questions or concerns regarding the processing of this request, please contact me directly.   Sincerely,   Reanna Guzman, CMC Deputy City Clerk | City of Hermosa Beach Phone: 310-318-0204 | Email: recordsrequest@hermosabeach.gov As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the City of Hermosa Beach portal. communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #24-174
communications.communication:
Hi Reanna,

Thank you for your prompt response and for submitting the request to Next Request. I appreciate your assistance with this matter.

I wanted to kindly express my preference to receive any responsive records through conventional means rather than through the portal. While I understand that the portal is meant to streamline processes, it presents some challenges on my end that I hope we can work around.

Using the portal as a requirement poses a few difficulties for me. Firstly, I have concerns about managing yet another set of login credentials. Keeping track of numerous passwords can sometimes become overwhelming, and I strive to maintain a manageable digital footprint.

Additionally, relying solely on the portal for record access may present accessibility issues. As much as possible, I try to ensure that my workflows are inclusive and accessible to all. Having alternative methods of accessing records ensures that everyone can participate fully.

I hope you understand that my request stems from a desire for efficiency and accessibility, as well as considerations of compliance with legal standards regarding accessibility and data management.

While I appreciate the convenience the portal offers, I believe it should supplement rather than replace traditional methods of communication.

Would it be possible to arrange for the records to be delivered via email or another conventional means? I want to ensure a smooth and accessible process for both parties involved.

Thank you once again for your understanding and cooperation. Please let me know if there are any further steps I need to take on my end.

Best regards,

Evan Rees
MuckRock News

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #24-174
communications.communication:
Hi Starla,

I hope you're doing well! I wanted to confirm the timeframe for the documents I'm requesting. It spans from January 1, 2006, through April 23, 2024. 

Also, your request for a time extension is fine with me. Take the time you need to ensure everything is processed smoothly.

*** Below you will find a revised FOIA request.

Thanks for your assistance with this!

Warm regards, Evan L Rees


Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request 

This letter serves as a formal request under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the applicable regulations, for access to records in the possession of any federal agency related to collaborative efforts between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department for covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, and domestic intelligence activities, specifically akin to COINTELPRO 2.0.

As an American citizen exercising my rights under the FOIA, I hereby request expedited processing of this request due to its significant public interest and the urgency of the matter.

I am seeking access to the following records:

1. Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs), agreements, or other formal documents establishing the terms, objectives, and scope of collaboration between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department for covert surveillance or intelligence-gathering operations.

2. Correspondence, emails, or communications exchanged between officials or representatives of any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department regarding the planning, coordination, or execution of covert operations or surveillance activities.

3. Operational plans, guidelines, or protocols developed jointly or separately by any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department governing the conduct of surveillance operations, including any directives or procedures for targeting individuals or groups.

4. Records of surveillance operations conducted in collaboration between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department, including logs, reports, or documentation of surveillance activities, as well as any warrants or legal authorization obtained for such operations.

5. Intelligence reports, analyses, or assessments produced as a result of collaborative surveillance efforts between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department, including assessments of potential threats, targets, or subjects of interest.

6. Training materials, manuals, or guides provided to personnel from the Hermosa Beach Police Department involved in collaborative surveillance programs or operations with any federal agency.

7. Budgetary documents or financial records related to the funding, allocation, or reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Hermosa Beach Police Department in collaboration with any federal agency for covert surveillance or intelligence activities.

Please provide all responsive records in electronic format, preferably via email or a secure online portal. If certain documents are exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation of the applicable exemptions and any segregable portions that can be released.

I request that this FOIA request be specifically processed for Evan L Rees, as the documents sought are requested in relation to myself.

I am willing to pay reasonable fees associated with this request. If the estimated fees exceed $50.00, please notify me in advance of processing the request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for your prompt handling of this request. I look forward to your timely response.

Sincerely,

Evan L Rees

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request #24-174
communications.communication:
*** CORRECTION ****

Darla, please accept my correction as that I am not requesting documents and records that pertain specially to me but rather any documents or records that fits the criteria contained within the request. I apologize for this oversight! 

Below is a new version of my request that reflects this correction:
Cordially,  Evan L Rees

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request – Request for Expedited Processing

This letter serves as a formal request under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the applicable regulations, for access to records in the possession of any federal agency related to collaborative efforts between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department for covert surveillance programs, counterintelligence operations, and domestic intelligence activities, specifically akin to COINTELPRO 2.0.

As an American citizen exercising my rights under the FOIA, I hereby request expedited processing of this request due to its significant public interest and the urgency of the matter.

I am seeking access to the following records:

    Memoranda of Understanding (MOUs), agreements, or other formal documents establishing the terms, objectives, and scope of collaboration between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department for covert surveillance or intelligence-gathering operations.

    Correspondence, emails, or communications exchanged between officials or representatives of any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department regarding the planning, coordination, or execution of covert operations or surveillance activities.

    Operational plans, guidelines, or protocols developed jointly or separately by any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department governing the conduct of surveillance operations, including any directives or procedures for targeting individuals or groups.

    Records of surveillance operations conducted in collaboration between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department, including logs, reports, or documentation of surveillance activities, as well as any warrants or legal authorization obtained for such operations.

    Intelligence reports, analyses, or assessments produced as a result of collaborative surveillance efforts between any federal agency and the Hermosa Beach Police Department, including assessments of potential threats, targets, or subjects of interest.

    Training materials, manuals, or guides provided to personnel from the Hermosa Beach Police Department involved in collaborative surveillance programs or operations with any federal agency.

    Budgetary documents or financial records related to the funding, allocation, or reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Hermosa Beach Police Department in collaboration with any federal agency for covert surveillance or intelligence activities.

Please provide all responsive records in electronic format, preferably via email or a secure online portal. If certain documents are exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation of the applicable exemptions and any segregable portions that can be released.

I would like to clarify that the FOIA request is not solely specific to myself, Evan L Rees. I apologize for any confusion caused by the oversight in the initial request. The documents and records requested pertain to any materials meeting the criteria outlined above, regardless of any personal association.

I am willing to pay reasonable fees associated with this request. If the estimated fees exceed $50.00, please notify me in advance of processing the request.

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for your prompt handling of this request. I look forward to your timely response.

Sincerely,

Evan L Rees
